title: Coolant Renew

body.body: D2053 OAT coolant contains corrosion inhibitors and antifreeze suitable for aluminium engines and radiators. Always use the coolant in accordance with the instructions of the manufacturer.
Coolant contains toxic chemicals that are harmful to the human body.
Contact with skin or eyes may cause severe irritation. Wear protective gloves, clothing and eye protection when handling coolant.
If coolant is inhaled, remove the person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing. In case of doubt or persistent symptoms, seek medical attention.
If coolant gets on your skin, flush with water immediately. Remove contaminated clothing.
If coolant gets in your eyes, flush with water for at least 15 minutes and SEEK MEDICAL ATTENTION IMMEDIATELY.
If coolant is swallowed, rinse the mouth with water and SEEK MEDICAL ATTENTION IMMEDIATELY.
KEEP COOLANT OUT OF THE REACH OF CHILDREN.
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Warning - Cooling - Do not remove the expansion tank or coolant pressure cap when engine is hot

Do not remove the expansion tank or coolant pressure cap when the engine is hot. When the engine is hot, the coolant inside the cooling system will be hot and may also be under pressure. Contact with hot coolant will cause scalds and skin damage.
Allow the engine to cool for a minimum of 30 minutes.
Triumph D2053 OAT is coloured orange compared to the Triumph HD4X OAT which is coloured green.
Do not mix D2053 OAT (orange) with HD4X OAT (green) antifreeze.
Mixing D2053 OAT and HD4X OAT will cause reduced corrosion resistance and the engine to overheat.
From VIN AG0784 the coolant was changed from Triumph HD4X Hybrid OAT coolant to Triumph D2053 OAT coolant.
If the Triumph HD4X Hybrid OAT coolant is drained the cooling system must be flushed through prior to filling the cooling system with the Triumph D2053 OAT coolant.
Drain the coolant and flush the system with clean water (see
